item.title: Question for people familiar with UK policing: how can I find out which department deals with which crime? E.g. GBH, criminal damage, murder etc. Are there just general detectives, or separate teams for each? Can anyone point me to a list? Ta. (This is research, not personal!)
item.dc:creator: @girlonetrack
item.description: Question for people familiar with UK policing: how can I find out which department deals with which crime? E.g. GBH, criminal damage, murder etc. Are there just general detectives, or separate teams for each? Can anyone point me to a list? Ta. (This is research, not personal!)

item.title: R to @janemerrick23: Once they know you have a food source for them, they'll be back daily (and will tell their friends!) - make sure you replenish the feeders frequently and you'll get them all year. Love goldfinches! If you have another feeder, try shell-less sunflower seeds: greenfinches love 'em!
item.dc:creator: @girlonetrack
item.description: Once they know you have a food source for them, they'll be back daily (and will tell their friends!) - make sure you replenish the feeders frequently and you'll get them all year. Love goldfinches! If you have another feeder, try shell-less sunflower seeds: greenfinches love 'em!

item.title: R to @tc_dunlop: Absolutely! 😀🍅
item.dc:creator: @girlonetrack
item.description: Absolutely! 😀🍅

item.title: R to @girlonetrack: I know most British gardeners are probably already eating full-sized ripe tomatoes that they’ve grown, but mine were sowed very late, so I’m delighted to see two of my plants have baby fruit on them finally! Hoping for a tomato glut in… erm… late September. 😅
item.dc:creator: @girlonetrack
item.description: I know most British gardeners are probably already eating full-sized ripe tomatoes that they’ve grown, but mine were sowed very late, so I’m delighted to see two of my plants have baby fruit on them finally! Hoping for a tomato glut in… erm… late September. 😅

item.title: R to @hopedickle: Don’t worry! With Roe vs Wade, it may feel like everything smaller is less vital right now, but all feminist battles are important and the fight continues on in the background. 😊✊🏼

item.description: Don’t worry! With Roe vs Wade, it may feel like everything smaller is less vital right now, but all feminist battles are important and the fight continues on in the background. 😊✊🏼

item.title: R to @CocoNPops: Yes! Wild guess and I was correct. Well done Coco!

item.title: R to @hopedickle: Not read the piece but female tennis players have been fighting for equality for years in their sport - one of those areas is the required (flesh revealing) skirt wear (not allowed shorts), so I can understand the need for menstruation to be taken into account in this struggle.
item.dc:creator: @girlonetrack
item.description: Not read the piece but female tennis players have been fighting for equality for years in their sport - one of those areas is the required (flesh revealing) skirt wear (not allowed shorts), so I can understand the need for menstruation to be taken into account in this struggle.

item.title: I still find it incredible that we’ve gone from this (1994, L) to this (2022, R) in under 30 years. I was so excited to get my first mobile phone then (free calls between 7pm-7am!) and just as excited now to be able to talk, on video, in real time, to friends across the globe.💜
item.dc:creator: @girlonetrack
item.description: I still find it incredible that we’ve gone from this (1994, L) to this (2022, R) in under 30 years. I was so excited to get my first mobile phone then (free calls between 7pm-7am!) and just as excited now to be able to talk, on video, in real time, to friends across the globe.💜

item.title: RT by @girlonetrack: Two points worth bearing in mind re the Roe v Wade decision for Brits wondering what the actual effect is: 1) 27 states had already enacted their own (varying) legislation to allow abortion, so at least it's not the case that all women in the US will now lose the right to choose>
item.dc:creator: @EllieCumbo
item.description: Two points worth bearing in mind re the Roe v Wade decision for Brits wondering what the actual effect is: 1) 27 states had already enacted their own (varying) legislation to allow abortion, so at least it's not the case that all women in the US will now lose the right to choose>

item.title: I really try to avoid posting on here when I'm angry, because I feel like social media inflames such emotions and it only adds to the toxic atmosphere online (hence tweeting about cats & gardening), but I'm SO FUCKING ANGRY about #RoeVsWade and I just don't know where else to go.
item.dc:creator: @girlonetrack
item.description: I really try to avoid posting on here when I'm angry, because I feel like social media inflames such emotions and it only adds to the toxic atmosphere online (hence tweeting about cats & gardening), but I'm SO FUCKING ANGRY about #RoeVsWade and I just don't know where else to go.

item.title: Take the goddamn Holocaust out of your disgusting misogynistic mouth. Don't talk about human dignity and welfare when you're condemning WOMEN to die, you absolute scum. Shame on you.
item.dc:creator: @girlonetrack
item.description:
